name: electricity production, hard coal | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6694/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity in an average hard coal power plant Peru in 2017.  'Hard coal' includes anthracite, coking coal and other bituminous coal according to the definition of the IEA electricity information 2014. This dataset is based on the GLO dataset, "electricity, high voltage electricity production, hard coal, GLO" (accesed October 2017), with adjustments to the peruvian context in year 2014. .The efficiency and net electricity production parameters updated using 2014 data fromr one plant in Peru, the ILO2 TV1. The ILO2 TV1 plant has a simple steam cycle and is located in the south of the country; this plant was built due to the unreliability of the Central - South connection of the country, which is why it enters into operation when the southern demand increases and the transmission lines can not meet the existing demand. This plant is being removed from operations as per the new transmission projects that have started implementation in 2017 (COES, 2014 and MINEM, 2014).;Comments on the inventory data of emissions: ;The fuel consumption per kWh considered in this dataset was obtained for one plant in Peru.;;The emissions of CO, CO2, CH4, SO2, NOx and particulates  were estimated  by using emisions factors from ;United States Environmental Protection Agency | US EPA (EPA, 1996), as per the recommendations found in OSINERGMIN, supervisory body for energy and mining investment (OSINERGMIN, 2017).                                                         (Ministerio de Energía y Minas, 2014; Subdirección de Gestión de la Información. COES, 2014)                                                                                                                                                                                                                             ;Other emissions were obtained from dataset "electricity, high voltage electricity production, hard coal, PE, 2008-2008" (accesed October 2017).;Net production of electricity : 163208370 kWh.;Sources: COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, (2014). Cap. 06 PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELÉCTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/06_PRODUCCION TERMOELECTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE ,CUADRO N° 6.2 RENDIMIENTO PROMEDIO ANUAL - 2014 and CUADRO N° 5.6 PRODUCCIÓN DE ENERGÍA ELECTRICA ANUAL POR CENTRAL Y TIPO DE GENERACIÓN 2014 (GW.h).  November 14, 2017. ;MINEM, 2014.Ministerio de Energía y Minas. Anuario Ejecutivo de Electricidad 2014. Dirección General de Electricidad. Retrieved online from http://www.minem.gob.pe/_estadisticaSector.php?idSector=6 ;OSINERGMIN, 2015. Oganismo Supervisor de la Energía y Mineria. La industria de los hidrocarburos líquidos en el Perú: 20 años de aporte al desarrollo del país, pp.36 (2015 )http://www.osinergmin.gob.pe/seccion/centro_documental/Institucional/Estudios_Economicos/Libros/anexo-industria-hidrocarburos-liquidos-Peru.pdf. Retrieved online 24 august 2017.        ;EPA, 1996. US Environmental Protection Agency (1996). AP 42 -Compilation of Air Pollutant Emission Factors, Volume 1: Stationary Point and Area Sources Compilation of Air Pollutant Emission Factors, AP-42, AP 42, Fifth Edition. Fuel Oil Combustion, F1.2;Anthracite Coal Combustion Final Section - Supplement B, October 1996 . https://www3.epa.gov/ttn/chief/ap42/ch01/index.html. Retrieved online 24 august 2017.     ;IEA. 2014. Electricity Information 2014. ISBN 978-92-64-21692-1. International Energy Agency (IEA), Paris Cedex (FR);European Environment Agency (1991) CORINAIR Inventory; VOC's Default Emission Factors

From the constructed hard coal power plant ready to produce electricity. 
From reception of hard coal and operating materials at power plant gate.

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and arrived at the busbar. 

This dataset includes: 
 - all operation and maintenance activities and materials of the power plants. 
 - Use of fuel oil for startup
 - Particle removal (dedusting of the flue gas)

  - Desulfurisation and denitrification. These processes are described in separate modules; it can be decided by changing the values of NOx and SOx retained whether and how much DeNOx and DeSOx are installed. 
 - Cooling: It is assumed that all plants use wet cooling with a cooling tower. No cooling tower is included in this dataset (will be implemented in future versions)
 - Loss of feed water 


This dataset doesn't include 
 - raw materials extraction, decommissioning and waste treatment as these activities are already included in the infrastructure datasets
 - transformation of the electricity produced
 - The disposal of non-recycled ashes is modelled separately.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2012.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: In Peru, the Economic Operation Committee of the National Interconnected System (COES) is divided in three operation areas, north, central and south. The power plant used to model this dataset is located in the south operation area.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: POWER PLANT:;As reported in "electricity, high voltage electricity production, hard coal, PE, 2008-2008" (accesed October 2017): Hard coal power plant input is a market mix of 100MWe power plants (representing all power plants with a capacity <250MWe and 7% of the installed capacity) and 500MWe power plants (representing all power plants with a capacity >250MWe and 93% of the installed capacity). The plants are used for middle load with 4000 hours of operation at full capacity per year. The plants are assumed to operate 150000 hours during its lifetime.;OTHER DATA:; - Share of installed capacity with desulfurisation 2% (rough estimation based on sulfur mass balance; - Average efficiency of desulfurisation installations: 92% (rough estimation based on Dones et al. 27; - Share of installed capacity with denitrification (primary and/or secondary installations): 73% (figure based on IEA 212 ); - Average efficiency of denitrification installations: 8% (estimation based on Dones et al. 27, p.128. Valid for selective catalytic reaction systems); - Share of installed capacity with particle filters: 98% (figure based on IEA 212 ); - Average efficiency of particle filters: 98% (figure based on IEA 212 );- IEA 2012. Coal Power Database. International Energy Agency Clean Coal Centre, London ; - IEA/OECD. 2010. Electricity Information 2010. International Energy Agency (IEA), Paris Cedex (FR). Part IV. Detailed OECD Electricity And Heat Data.; - Dones, R., Bauer, C., Röder, A. (2007) Kohle. In: Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. Final report ecoinvent No.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset is based on GLO dataset, "electricity, high voltage electricity production, hard coal, GLO" (accesed October 2017), with extrapolations  to the peruvian context in year 2014. Net annual production and efficiency for the country in 2014 were used. The hard coal  consumption per kWh considered in this dataset was obtained from the production of high voltage electricity in an average hard coal power plant ILO2 TV1 of enterprise ENERSUR  in 2014 (COES, 2014). Hard coal is calculated as the sum of coking coal and steam coal (IEA 2009).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Statistical data for one power plant in Peru.

exchanges.description:
Calculated Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity, in a hard coal power plant. The electricity production data and fuel consumption correspond to one hard coal power plant in Peru called "ILO2 TV1". The power plant consumed 60320.91 tonnes of coal producing 1.6321E+08 kWh of electricity (Subdirección de Gestión de la Información. COES, 2014). 

The emission values were estimated with EPA emissions factor for carbon dioxide (2840 kg CO2/tonne coal)  (EPA, 1996).

The calorific value used was (7053.75 kcal/kg). Source: <http://sisbib.unmsm.edu.pe/bibvirtualdata/publicaciones/geologia/vol11_n22/a03vol11n22.pdf> consulted 24 august 2017.

The coal type was defined as anthracite because 83.15% of the coal consumed in Peru is anthracite. Source: <http://sisbib.unmsm.edu.pe/bibvirtualdata/publicaciones/geologia/vol11_n22/a03vol11n22.pdf> consulted 24 august 2017 .

Sources:                
COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, (2014). Cap. 06 PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELÉCTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE. exchanges.description:
Calculated value. At the moment, the hard coal power plant input consists of a market mix of a 100MWe power plant and a 500MWe power plant
. 
For this calculation, 4000 load hours per year are assumed. It is assumed that a total of 150'000h is reached during the lifetime. A capacity of 500MW is taken for the calculation.

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Hard coal ash produced when producing 1kWh of electricity from hard coal, based on the value for burning 1MJ of hard coal. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and values of 12 countries 
(AT, BE, ES, FR, IT, NL, PT, DE, CZ, HR, PL, SK). These values were valid for the ash being disposed off. Now, total amount of ash has been calculated (disposed+recycled) with the data in Tab. 9.69 p. 165 in Röder et al. 2007. Globally, 74% of the lignite ash are recycled, 26% go to disposal.
 
Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.
